      • simpleParser

        public static int simpleParser(char[] source,
                               int from,
                               java.lang.String template,
                               int[][] locations)

        Simple parser to extract data from the char string

        All chars in the template expresses self, except special escapes. The set of escapes is:

        • '{', '|', '}' - alternatives. Every alternative start need differs each other, except (possibly) the same last alternative (pointed as default)
        • '[', ']' - optional. Need to have explicit differentiation from the next data.
        • '<', '>seq...' - repeatable clauses. Seq can be any non-escaped char sequence without special chars

        Also a special escapes can be used:

        • '%b' - any blank chars
        • '%c' - any non-blank text
        • '%NNNc' - any non-blank text. It's start and end position will be stored to to parsing result array
        • '%d' - any decimal
        • '%NNNd' - any decimal. It's start and end position will be stored to to parsing result array
        • '%NNN:VVVm' - set location NNN with the value VVV. Not really parses data but can use for marking alternatives
        • '%{', '%|', '%}', '%[', '%]', '%<', '%>', '%%' - chars as-is
        Parameters:
        source - source string to parse
        from - start position to parse
        template - parse template to manage parsing
        locations - all %NNNc and %NNNd locations was detected. Non-used members of this array fill be filled by [-1,-1] values.
        Returns:
        end position in the parsed string

      • simpleParser

        public static int simpleParser(char[] source,
                               int from,
                               char[] template,
                               int[][] locations)

        Simple parser to extract data from the char string

        All chars in the template expresses self, except special escapes. The set of escapes is:

        • '{', '|', '}' - alternatives. Every alternative start need differs each other, except (possibly) the same last alternative (pointed as default)
        • '[', ']' - optional. Need to have explicit differentiation from the next data.
        • '<', '>seq...' - repeatable clauses. Seq can be any non-escaped char sequence without special chars

        Also a special escapes can be used:

        • '%b' - any blank chars
        • '%c' - any non-blank text
        • '%NNNc' - any non-blank text. It's start and end position will be stored to to parsing result array
        • '%d' - any decimal
        • '%NNNd' - any decimal. It's start and end position will be stored to to parsing result array
        • '%NNN:VVVm' - set location NNN with the value VVV. Not really parses data but can use for marking alternatives
        • '%{', '%|', '%}', '%[', '%]', '%<', '%>', '%%' - chars as-is
        Parameters:
        source - source string to parse
        from - start position to parse
        template - parse template to manage parsing
        locations - all %NNNc and %NNNd locations was detected. Non-used members of this array fill be filled by [] values. Repeatable clauses will have 2*N elements. Can be null, if locations are not interested
        Returns:
        end position in the parsed string

      • unify

        public static boolean unify(IFProEntity peek,
                            IFProEntity entity,
                            FProUtil.Change[] changesList)

        Unify two entities and bind variables. Entities after unification will have corrupted parent refs. To restore them call unbind

        Parameters:
        peek - entity will be unified with.
        entity - entity to unify with
        changesList - changes in the entities (modelling parameters by refs). Need always be an array wit exactly one (non)null element. Will be filled with changes
        Returns:
        true if unification is successful

      • unbind

        public static void unbind(FProUtil.Change top)

        Restore two unified entities to it's original state.

        Parameters:
        top - content of the changesList[0] (see unify(IFProEntity, IFProEntity, Change[]))

        Duplicate entity with all children

        Parameters:
        source - item to duplicate. Null source returns null result
        Returns:
        duplicated item

        public static boolean isEntityA(IFProEntity entity,
                                FProUtil.ContentType type)

        Test entity type in the FPro terminlogy

        Parameters:
        entity - entity to test
        type - check type (according to FRpo tests)
        Returns:
